review: We had very high hopes for this device and ordered it to have it the day it was released.  We have it on our upstairs (router is downstairs) TV and are lucky if we can get it to connect to the wifi for a minute on a clear night.  if there is any bad weather or more than one person is using an internet connected device forget it.  Do not buy this, go for the more robust model or a chrome-cast instead.

review: I really loved this for two months.  Aside from a few minor complaints about how some of the channels operated, it was great.  And it pretty much paid for itself, saving me on my electric bill since I no longer needed to run my computer to watch Youtube or Netflix.Then one day for no reason at all, it stopped working.  With no rhyme or reason, it would decide not to connect to my local network, or sometimes not to the internet, or sometimes it would connect but then drop that connection a few seconds/minutes later.  Sometimes the connection wouldn't drop at all, but I would get terrible video quality and frequent buffering.  Not only did it not work, but there was no consistency in how it wouldn't work.  In the meantime, multiple cell phones, computers, tablets, printers, and all other manner of wireless device continued to connect to the wireless network and internet without any problems.  I've tried numerous fixes including changing my wireless router's channel to every channel available, disabling wireless security, disabling the firewall, and setting the Roku up in a DMZ, all to no avail.  While I may have simply received a dud, given my experience with it, I can't recommend it.  Your results may vary.Addendum:  Just to clarify and in response to the comment to my review, I have a 15mbps internet connection and I frequently watch Netflix and Youtube videos in HD on my computer without any problems.  This is not a problem with my connection being too slow.
author: K. Childers "Juggernaut"
